# Analysis of üíª‚îÇdevelopers Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat segment is brief, containing a discussion about modifying the core functionality of what appears to be a HYP platform or framework. 3rdEyeVisuals has implemented a modification that allows users to upload raw .js files as apps instead of requiring .hyp bundles. This change makes the platform more accessible to users unfamiliar with .hyp bundles by leveraging the base HYP BUNDLER to handle the bundling process. However, this implementation has a limitation: while the sidebar apps menu can now detect .js files as apps (after updates), the Layers world view cannot display these .js files properly because they lack the metadata present in .hyp bundles. 3rdEyeVisuals is seeking guidance on whether to further modify the core files to fully support .js apps throughout the system.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Would it be worth modifying the core files some more to fully support straight .js apps? (asked by 3rdEyeVisuals) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions
None identified in this chat segment.

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Consider modifying core files to fully support .js files in the Layers world view | Description: Extend the current implementation to allow .js files to appear properly in the Layers world view by handling missing metadata | Mentioned By: 3rdEyeVisuals
Technical: Upload examples of different implementations | Description: Share various implementation examples as promised | Mentioned By: MetaRick

# Discord Chat Analysis

## 1. Summary
The chat segment is brief and contains minimal technical discussion. Ash mentions they are working on something that won't appear in the updates channel, and notes that v1 has been running smoothly for almost a year without intervention. They're now trying to reacquaint themselves with how the system works. There's a brief mention of a "Legacy" system that may be coming back online soon, and a reference to V2, though no technical details are provided. One user (Harambe Advocate) explicitly states they don't know how to code and aren't interested in learning.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Legacy back up soon? (asked by Harambe Advocate) A: Unanswered
Q: Have you played around with V2 at all? (asked by 3rdEyeVisuals) A: No I dont know how to code (answered by Harambe Advocate)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: ùïΩùñîùñöùñòùñôùñÜùñì | Helpee: Harambe Advocate | Context: Unspecified help related to earlier conversation | Resolution: Direct message sent

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Working on undisclosed feature that won't appear in updates channel | Description: Relearning v1 system that has been running autonomously for a year | Mentioned By: ash

The chat segment is very brief, containing only two messages. Nicola Bertoglio inquired about creating objects that could make non-admin avatars jump higher in a virtual environment. Dhin responded by suggesting a book object that can be placed in the environment, which allows avatars to perform flips or double jumps when users press the F key. This indicates the existence of interactive objects that can enhance avatar movement capabilities within the platform.
